definition: to wrap up/to bind up/bundle/parcel/package/CL:個|个[ge4]
to stand still without advancing (idiom); to hesitate and hold back
foot-binding/long strip of cloth used for foot-binding
to be buried in a horse hide (idiom)/to give one's life on the battlefield
to wrap up/(fig.) to envelop/to swallow up
too frightened to move or speak
to wrap tightly/to wind tightly/to bind/close-fitting (clothes)

pinyin: Lian2 he2 Bao1 guo3 Fu2 wu4 Gong1 si1

sentences.english: The coachman wrapped himself up in his cloak.
The pain had become constant in the last two months and was associated with diarrhea and tenesmus.
sentences.chinese: 近二個月有持續疼痛的情形，且合併腹瀉及裹急後重。

sentences.english: Our fur-clad descendents will be crouched over fires.
sentences.chinese: 我們的子孫將穿裘裹皮，蜷縮在火堆旁。

sentences.english: I bread the fish before I cook it.
sentences.chinese: 我在烹調魚之前會先把它裹上面包粉。

sentences.english: Were they not born, have to eat, get hungry and so on?
sentences.chinese: 難道他們不會餓，不需要食物裹腹？

sentences.english: Her left elbow was wrapped in gauze, but she otherwise appeared alert.
sentences.chinese: 她左臂用紗布裹着，但是她還是很警覺的。

sentences.english: He was a school teacher, a Brahmin, with a clean dhoti.
sentences.chinese: 他是個學校老師，一個婆羅門人，裹着乾淨的腰布。

sentences.english: He tore other strips and bound them about his feet to serve for both moccasins and socks.
sentences.chinese: 此外，他又撕下幾條，裹在腳上，代替鹿皮鞋和襪子。

sentences.english: His left hand, which rested on his enamelled sword hilt, was bandaged.
sentences.chinese: 他那按在寶劍琺琅柄上的左手外面裹着繃帶。

sentences.english: He had worn through the blanket- wrappings , and his feet were shapeless lumps of raw meat.
sentences.chinese: 腳下裹的毯子都磨穿了，腳也被磨得沒一處好肉。

sentences.english: Jun 6 to eat the most fashionable "wrapped roll."
This too looked red and raw. There was no bandage.
sentences.chinese: 這裏也紅紅的，好像擦傷了，但是沒有裹上繃帶。

sentences.english: To "worship in truth" means to worship God as he is truly revealed in the Bible.
sentences.chinese: 意思是照着聖經裹所啓示的那位神來敬拜祂。

sentences.english: "Where do you put the tinfoil?" a man asks.
sentences.chinese: “您把錫箔裹在哪裏？”一個男士問。

sentences.english: A pelican sits covered with oil in Barataria Bay, Louisiana
sentences.chinese: 巴拉塔里亞灣，一隻裹滿石油的褐鵜鶘臥在水裏。

sentences.english: Add Arborio rice and stir well to coat with butter. Cook for 2 minutes.
sentences.chinese: 加入中東米，拌勻，炒2分鐘或使在中東米裹上黃油。

definition: to wrap up/to bind up/bundle/parcel/package/CL:個|个[ge4]
to wrap tightly/to wind tightly/to bind/close-fitting (clothes)
variant of 捲起|卷起[juan3 qi3]
to glue/to paste/to adhere/to stick to
to freeze/to feel very cold/aspic or jelly
